creator: jose@w3.org
text:
Hi! 

Could it be possible to include more content-negotation
related tests in your qa process for Apache? 

Bug 41960[1] has a simple test scenario that used to work 
on v1.1.3 and stopped doing so on v2.2.4. It could have been 
caught early on and solved by people who know the code better 
than I do :) 

Many Thanks in advance from all of us Apache users and develoeprs
who use content-negotation.

-jose

[1] http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=41960

Patches welcome.  But in the absence of a patch, or at least a specific
proposal, this isn't really a matter for bugzilla.  Of course, if you're about
to add a patch, feel free to reopen!
creator: nick@webthing.com
jose@w3.org
text:
With all due respect, the link I gave to bug 4960 has a pertinent and
reproducible content-negotiation test scenario that used to work on v1.3.x
and stopped working on v2.2.4. Following initial feedback from you, I submitted 
a patch there and have no idea when the Apache team will review it.

This bug could have been previously detected following that or a similar simple 
test scenario.  I'd would be glad to submit a patch for your test suite so that 
this cases can be part of them in the future. However, I've no idea what kind 
of test suite you use for testing the Apache server. It doesn't seem to be 
related to the test subdirectory.

If you could give more pointers to code and documentation to your QA test 
suite, I'd be more than happy to contribute new code for these tests. It would
save me more time if they would be tested before each release. Meanwhile, the 
most I can do is to point out the lack of content negotiation testing that has 
given arise to these bugs.

Cheers,

-jose
